title: Memoir of James Wyld of Gilston, and his family
snippet: She got well qualified Professors, and Medical Practitioners , and Specialists, to expound and enforce the observance of these laws, which at once form one of the widest and the most important of practical sciences. The success of the effort was wonderful, the numbers who crowded to receive instruction increased  so fast, that the places of meeting had to be shifted again and again during the first year, till they resorted to the United Presbyterian Hall on Castle Terrace. They afterwards, I understand, rented the Free Church Hall.

title: Twelve thousand miles over land and sea;
author: Hutton, William
snippet: From the Castle Terrace, we see
